result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Brinsko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
In lieu of payment defendant to serve an additional 5 days in the Waukesha County Jail, consecutive to the 25 days.  Apply 5 days sentence credit.  Time served.  Costs and Surcharge are deemed paid in full.

Straight Time.
Apply 25 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew J Brinsko in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

Court orders the following:
25 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
25 Days Credit.
Time Served.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
In Lieu of Payment - Defendant to Serve an Additional 5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Consecutive to the 25 Days - 5 Days Credit - Time Served.

Cash Bond Converted to a Signature Bond in the Amount of:  $250
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrew J Brinsko in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  
Motion filed by the Defense - Bail Modification (Reduction of Cash Bail or Signature Bond).

Atty. Weathers presented arguments to the court (PO Agent has an ATR at Cephus House).
State has no objections.

Court Grants - Bail Modification.

CONDITIONS:

Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
